name: scaleway
description: A Pulumi package for creating and managing Scaleway resources.
attribution: This Pulumi package is based on the [`scaleway` Terraform Provider](https://github.com/scaleway/terraform-provider-scaleway).

nodejs.packageDescription: A Pulumi package for creating and managing Scaleway resources.
nodejs.readme:
> This provider is a derived work of the [Terraform Provider](https://github.com/scaleway/terraform-provider-scaleway)
> distributed under [MPL 2.0](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/MPL/2.0/). If you encounter a bug or missing feature,
> first check the [`pulumi-scaleway` repo](https://github.com/dirien/pulumi-scaleway/issues); however, if that doesn't turn up anything,
> please consult the source [`terraform-provider-scaleway` repo](https://github.com/scaleway/terraform-provider-scaleway/issues).

metricsUrl.description: (Deprecated) URL for [metrics](https://www.scaleway.com/en/docs/observability/cockpit/concepts/#metric) to retrieve in the [Data sources tab](https://console.scaleway.com/cockpit/dataSource) of the Scaleway console.

failureThreshold.description: Number of consecutive health check failures before considering the container unhealthy.

concurrentRequestsThreshold.description: Scale depending on the number of concurrent requests being processed per container instance.

memoryUsageThreshold.description: Scale depending on the memory usage of a container instance.

domainName.description: The Fully Qualified Domain Name (in the format subdomain.example.com) to use in HTTP requests sent towards your Load Balancer.

id.description: The ID of the Load Balancer.

isSsl.description: Defines whether the Load Balancer's frontend handles SSL connections.

zone.description: `zone`) The zone of the Load Balancer.

isWebsite.description: Defines whether the bucket website feature is enabled.

all.description: Defines whether to purge all content.

assets.description: The list of asserts to purge.

pipelineId.description: The pipeline ID in which the purge request will be created.

backendStageId.description: The ID of the backend stage that requests matching the rule should be forwarded to.

ruleHttpMatch.description: The rule condition to be matched. Requests matching the condition defined here will be directly forwarded to the backend specified by the `backend_stage_id` field. Requests that do not match will be checked by the next rule's condition.

methodFilters.description: HTTP methods to filter for. A request using any of these methods will be considered to match the rule. Possible values are `get`, `post`, `put`, `patch`, `delete`, `head`, `options`. All methods will match if none is provided.

pathFilter.description: HTTP URL path to filter for. A request whose path matches the given filter will be considered to match the rule. All paths will match if none is provided.

pathFilterType.description: The type of filter to match for the HTTP URL path. For now, all path filters must be written in regex and use the `regex` type.

value.description: The value to be matched for the HTTP URL path.

region.description: The region of the secret.

projectId.description: THe ID of the project that contains the Messaging and Queuing NATS account (defaults to provider `project_id`)

region.description: Region where the Messaging and Queuing NATS account is enabled (defaults to provider `region`)

namespaceId.description: ID of the Messaging and Queuing namespace. This argument is deprecated.
namespaceId.deprecationMessage: The 'namespace_id' field is deprecated and will be removed in the next major version. It is no longer necessary to specify it

projectId.description: The ID of the project in which SQS is enabled, (defaults to provider `project_id`)

queue.description: The name of the SQS queue.

region.description: Region where SQS is enabled (defaults to provider `region`)

condition.description:
The condition of the rule.

**_TIP:_** You can use the Scaleway CLI to list the permissions details. e.g:

```shell
scw iam permission-set list
```

organizationId.description: ID of organization scoped to the rule, this can be used to create a rule for all projects in an organization.

permissionSetNames.description: Names of permission sets bind to the rule.

projectIds.description:
List of project IDs scoped to the rule.

> **Important** One `organization_id` or `project_ids` must be set per rule.

disableAuth.description: Disable the authentication on the endpoint.

id.description: (Optional) The id of the public endpoint.

privateNetworkId.description: The ID of the private network to use.

id.description: (Optional) The id of the public endpoint.

disableAuth.description: Disable the authentication on the endpoint.

id.description: (Optional) The id of the public endpoint.

quantizations.description: A list of supported quantization options, including:

maxContextSize.description: Maximum context length supported by this quantization.

quantizationBits.description: Number of bits used for quantization (e.g., 8, 16).

exportUri.description: The export URI of the volume.

id.description: ID of the server containing the volume.

name.description: The name of the image. If not provided it will be randomly generated.

organization.description: The organization ID the volume is associated with.

project.description: ID of the project the volume is associated with

server.description: Description of the server containing the volume (in case the image is a backup from a server).

size.description: The size of the volume.

tags.description: A list of tags to apply to the image.

volumeType.description: The type of volume, possible values are `l_ssd` and `b_ssd`.

zone.description: The zone in which the image should be created.

id.description: The ID of the IP address resource.

action.description: The action to take when rule match. Possible values are: `accept` or `drop`.

ip.description: The ip this rule apply to. If no `ip` nor `ip_range` are specified, rule will apply to all ip. Only one of `ip` and `ip_range` should be specified.
ip.deprecationMessage: Ip address is deprecated. Please use ip_range instead

ipRange.description: The ip range (e.g `192.168.1.0/24`) this rule applies to. If no `ip` nor `ip_range` are specified, rule will apply to all ip. Only one of `ip` and `ip_range` should be specified.

port.description: The port this rule applies to. If no `port` nor `port_range` are specified, the rule will apply to all port. Only one of `port` and `port_range` should be specified.

portRange.description: Computed port range for this rule (e.g: 1-1024, 22-22)

protocol.description: The protocol this rule apply to. Possible values are: `TCP`, `UDP`, `ICMP` or `ANY`.

action.description: Action when rule match request (drop or accept)

ip.description: Ip address for this rule (e.g: 1.1.1.1). Only one of ip or ip_range should be provided

id.description: The ID of the IP address resource.

zone.description: `zone`) The zone in which the server should be created.

id.description: The ID of the IP

boot.description: Set the volume where the boot the server

deleteOnTermination.description: Forces deletion of the root volume on instance termination.

name.description: The name of the server.

sbsIops.description:
Choose IOPS of your sbs volume, has to be used with `sbs_volume` for root volume type.

> **Important:** Updates to `root_volume.size_in_gb` will be ignored after the creation of the server.

sizeInGb.description:
Size of the root volume in gigabytes.
To find the right size use [this endpoint](https://www.scaleway.com/en/developers/api/instance/#path-instances-list-all-instances) and
check the `volumes_constraint.{min|max}_size` (in bytes) for your `commercial_type`.
Depending on `volume_type`, updates to this field may recreate a new resource.

volumeId.description: The volume ID of the root volume of the server, allows you to create server with an existing volume. If empty, will be computed to a created volume ID.

volumeType.description: Volume type of root volume, can be `l_ssd` or `sbs_volume`, default value depends on server type

bucket.description: Bucket name containing [qcow2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Qcow) to import

key.description:
Key of the object to import

> **Note:** The type `unified` could be instantiated on both `l_ssd` and `b_ssd` volumes.

crt.description: X509 PEM encoded certificate of the device

key.description: The private key of the device, in case it is generated by Scaleway.

publish.description: Rules used to restrict topics the device can publish to.

subscribe.description: Rules used to restrict topics the device can subscribe to.

topics.description:
Same as publish rules.

- `certificate.crt` - (Optional) The certificate of the device, either generated by Scaleway or provided.

> **Important:** Updates to `certificate.crt` will disconnect connected devices and the previous certificate will be deleted and won't be recoverable.

host.description: The database hostname. Can be an IP or a FQDN.

password.description: The database password.

query.description: The SQL query that will be executed when receiving a message ($TOPIC and $PAYLOAD variables are available, see documentation, e.g. `INSERT INTO mytable(date, topic, value) VALUES (NOW(), $TOPIC, $PAYLOAD)`).

headers.description: a map of the extra headers to send with the HTTP call (e.g. `X-Header = Value`).

uri.description: The URI of the Rest endpoint (e.g. `https://internal.mycompany.com/ingest/mqttdata`).

verb.description: The HTTP Verb used to call Rest URI (e.g. `post`).

bucketName.description: The name of the S3 route's destination bucket (e.g. `my-object-storage`).

bucketRegion.description: The region of the S3 route's destination bucket (e.g. `fr-par`).

objectPrefix.description: The string to prefix object names with (e.g. `mykeyprefix-`).

strategy.description: How the S3 route's objects will be created (e.g. `per_topic`). See [documentation](https://www.scaleway.com/en/docs/iot-hub/how-to/create-route/) for behaviour details.

macAddress.description: The MAC address of the resource the IP is attached to.

name.description: The name of the resource the IP is attached to.

id.description: The ID of the resource that the IP is attached to.

macAddress.description: The MAC address of the resource the IP is attached to.

name.description: The name of the resource the IP is attached to.

type.description: The type of resource the IP is attached to.

address.description: The IP corresponding to the hostname

privateNetworkId.description: The Private Network of the IP (if the IP is a private IP).

subnetId.description: The Private Network subnet of the IP (if the IP is a private IP).

zonal.description: The zone of the IP (if the IP is public and zoned, rather than private and/or regional)

timezone.description: The timezone, must be a canonical TZ identifier as found in this [list](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_tz_database_time_zones).

environment.description: An environment variable containing the secret value. Must be specified if `file` is not specified.

file.description: The absolute file path where the secret will be mounted. Must be specified if `environment` is not specified.

secretId.description: The secret unique identifier, it could be formatted as region/UUID or UUID. In case the region is passed, it must be the same as the job definition. You could reference the same secret multiple times in the same job definition.

secretReferenceId.description: The secret reference UUID that is automatically generated by the provider.

id.description: The ID of the ACL resource. It is the same as the ID of the cluster.

ip.description:
The IP range to whitelist in [CIDR notation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Classless_Inter-Domain_Routing#CIDR_notation)

> **Important:** If the `ip` field is set, `scaleway_ranges` cannot be set to true in the same rule.

scalewayRanges.description:
Allow access to cluster from all Scaleway ranges as defined in [Scaleway Network Information - IP ranges used by Scaleway](https://www.scaleway.com/en/docs/console/account/reference-content/scaleway-network-information/#ip-ranges-used-by-scaleway).
Only one rule with this field set to true can be added.

> **Important:** If the `scaleway_ranges` field is set to true, the `ip` field cannot be set on the same rule.

enable.description:
Set to `true` to enable Kubernetes patch version auto upgrades.
> **Important:** When enabling auto upgrades, the `version` field take a minor version like x.y (ie 1.18).

maintenanceWindowDay.description: The day of the auto upgrade maintenance window (`monday` to `sunday`, or `any`).

maintenanceWindowStartHour.description: The start hour (UTC) of the 2-hour auto upgrade maintenance window (0 to 23).

balanceSimilarNodeGroups.description: Detect similar node groups and balance the number of nodes between them.

disableScaleDown.description: Disables the scale down feature of the autoscaler.

estimator.description: Type of resource estimator to be used in scale up.

expander.description: Type of node group expander to be used in scale up.

expendablePodsPriorityCutoff.description: Pods with priority below cutoff will be expendable. They can be killed without any consideration during scale down and they don't cause scale up. Pods with null priority (PodPriority disabled) are non expendable.

ignoreDaemonsetsUtilization.description: Ignore DaemonSet pods when calculating resource utilization for scaling down.

maxGracefulTerminationSec.description: Maximum number of seconds the cluster autoscaler waits for pod termination when trying to scale down a node

scaleDownDelayAfterAdd.description: How long after scale up that scale down evaluation resumes.

scaleDownUnneededTime.description: How long a node should be unneeded before it is eligible for scale down.

scaleDownUtilizationThreshold.description: Node utilization level, defined as sum of requested resources divided by capacity, below which a node can be considered for scale down

clusterCaCertificate.description: The CA certificate of the Kubernetes API server.

host.description: The URL of the Kubernetes API server.

token.description: The token to connect to the Kubernetes API server.

clientId.description: A client id that all tokens must be issued for

groupsClaims.description: JWT claim to use as the user's group

issuerUrl.description: URL of the provider which allows the API server to discover public signing keys

requiredClaims.description: Multiple key=value pairs that describes a required claim in the ID Token

usernameClaim.description: JWT claim to use as the user name

id.description: The ID of the IP address resource.

name.description:
The name for the pool.

> **Important:** Updates to this field will recreate a new resource.

privateIps.description: The list of private IPv4 and IPv6 addresses associated with the node.

publicIp.description: The public IPv4. (Deprecated, Please use the official Kubernetes provider and the kubernetes_nodes data source)
publicIp.deprecationMessage: Please use the official Kubernetes provider and the kubernetes_nodes data source

publicIpV6.description: The public IPv6. (Deprecated, Please use the official Kubernetes provider and the kubernetes_nodes data source)
publicIpV6.deprecationMessage: Please use the official Kubernetes provider and the kubernetes_nodes data source

id.description: The ID of the IP address resource.

maxSurge.description: The maximum number of nodes to be created during the upgrade

maxUnavailable.description: The maximum number of nodes that can be not ready at the same time

redirects.description: Redirect parameters when using an ACL with `redirect` action.

type.description: The action type. Possible values are: `allow` or `deny` or `redirect`.

code.description: The HTTP redirect code to use. Valid values are `301`, `302`, `303`, `307` and `308`.

target.description: An URL can be used in case of a location redirect (e.g. `https://scaleway.com` will redirect to this same URL). A scheme name (e.g. `https`, `http`, `ftp`, `git`) will replace the request's original scheme.

type.description: The redirect type. Possible values are: `location` or `scheme`.

httpFilter.description:
The HTTP filter to match. This filter is supported only if your backend protocol has an HTTP forward protocol.
It extracts the request's URL path, which starts at the first slash and ends before the question mark (without the host part).
Possible values are: `acl_http_filter_none`, `path_begin`, `path_end`, `http_header_match` or `regex`.

httpFilterOption.description: If you have `http_filter` at `http_header_match`, you can use this field to filter on the HTTP header's value.

httpFilterValues.description:
A list of possible values to match for the given HTTP filter.

scaleway:index/accountProject:AccountPro.description:
## Import

Projects can be imported using the `id` argument, as shown below:

bash

```sh
$ pulumi import scaleway:index/accountProject:AccountProject project 11111111-1111-1111-1111-111111111111
```

scaleway:index/cockpit:Cockpit.description:
## Import

This section explains how to import a Cockpit using its `{project_id}`.

bash

```sh
$ pulumi import scaleway:index/cockpit:Cockpit main 11111111-1111-1111-1111-111111111111
```

name.description: The name of the record (can be an empty string for a root record).

priority.description: The priority of the record (mostly used with an `MX` record).

projectId.description: The project_id you want to attach the resource to

rootZone.description: Does the DNS zone is the root zone or not

ttl.description: Time To Live of the record in seconds.

type.description: The type of the record (`A`, `AAAA`, `MX`, `CNAME`, `DNAME`, `ALIAS`, `NS`, `PTR`, `SRV`, `TXT`, `TLSA`, or `CAA`).

views.description: Return record based on client subnet

scaleway:index/function:Function.description:
## Import

Functions can be imported using, `{region}/{id}`, as shown below:

bash

```sh
$ pulumi import scaleway:index/function:Function main fr-par/11111111-1111-1111-1111-111111111111
```

cpuLimit.description: The CPU limit in mVCPU for your function.

domainName.description: The native domain name of the function.

handler.description: Handler of the function, depends on the runtime. Refer to the [dedicated documentation](https://www.scaleway.com/en/developers/api/serverless-functions/#path-functions-create-a-new-function) for the list of supported runtimes.

httpOption.description: Allows both HTTP and HTTPS (`enabled`) or redirect HTTP to HTTPS (`redirected`). Defaults to `enabled`.

maxScale.description: The maximum number of instances this function can scale to. Default to 20. Your function will scale automatically based on the incoming workload, but will never exceed the configured `max_scale` value.

memoryLimit.description: The memory resources in MB to allocate to each function. Defaults to 256 MB.

minScale.description: The minimum number of function instances running continuously. Defaults to 0. Functions are billed when executed, and using a `min_scale` greater than 0 will cause your function to run constantly.

name.description: The unique name of the function name.

namespaceId.description:
The Functions namespace ID of the function.

> **Important** Updating the `name` argument will recreate the function.

organizationId.description: The organization ID the function is associated with.

privacy.description: The privacy type defines the way to authenticate to your function. Please check our dedicated [section](https://www.scaleway.com/en/developers/api/serverless-functions/#protocol-9dd4c8).

privateNetworkId.description:
The ID of the Private Network the function is connected to.

> **Important** This feature is currently in beta and requires a namespace with VPC integration activated by setting the `activate_vpc_integration` attribute to `true`.

projectId.description: `project_id`) The ID of the project the functions namespace is associated with.

region.description: `region`). The region in which the namespace should be created.

runtime.description: Runtime of the function. Runtimes can be fetched using [specific route](https://www.scaleway.com/en/developers/api/serverless-functions/#path-functions-get-a-function)

tags.description: The list of tags associated with the function.

timeout.description: The maximum amount of time your function can spend processing a request before being stopped. Defaults to 300s.

zipFile.description: Path to the zip file containing your function sources to upload.

zipHash.description: The hash of your source zip file, changing it will re-apply function. Can be any string

handler.description: Handler of the function, depends on the runtime. Refer to the [dedicated documentation](https://www.scaleway.com/en/developers/api/serverless-functions/#path-functions-create-a-new-function) for the list of supported runtimes.

httpOption.description: Allows both HTTP and HTTPS (`enabled`) or redirect HTTP to HTTPS (`redirected`). Defaults to `enabled`.

maxScale.description: The maximum number of instances this function can scale to. Default to 20. Your function will scale automatically based on the incoming workload, but will never exceed the configured `max_scale` value.

memoryLimit.description: The memory resources in MB to allocate to each function. Defaults to 256 MB.

minScale.description: The minimum number of function instances running continuously. Defaults to 0. Functions are billed when executed, and using a `min_scale` greater than 0 will cause your function to run constantly.

name.description: The unique name of the function name.

namespaceId.description:
The Functions namespace ID of the function.

> **Important** Updating the `name` argument will recreate the function.

privacy.description: The privacy type defines the way to authenticate to your function. Please check our dedicated [section](https://www.scaleway.com/en/developers/api/serverless-functions/#protocol-9dd4c8).

The ID of the Private Network the function is connected to.

> **Important** This feature is currently in beta and requires a namespace with VPC integration activated by setting the `activate_vpc_integration` attribute to `true`.

region.description: `region`). The region in which the namespace should be created.

httpOption.description: Allows both HTTP and HTTPS (`enabled`) or redirect HTTP to HTTPS (`redirected`). Defaults to `enabled`.

maxScale.description: The maximum number of instances this function can scale to. Default to 20. Your function will scale automatically based on the incoming workload, but will never exceed the configured `max_scale` value.

memoryLimit.description: The memory resources in MB to allocate to each function. Defaults to 256 MB.

minScale.description: The minimum number of function instances running continuously. Defaults to 0. Functions are billed when executed, and using a `min_scale` greater than 0 will cause your function to run constantly.

timeout.description: The maximum amount of time your function can spend processing a request before being stopped. Defaults to 300s.

scaleway:index/inferenceDeployment:Infer.description:
Creates and manages Scaleway Managed Inference deployments.
For more information, see the [API documentation](https://www.scaleway.com/en/developers/api/inference/).

## Example Usage

### Basic

<!--Start PulumiCodeChooser -->
```yaml
resources:
  deployment:
    type: scaleway:InferenceDeployment
    properties:
      nodeType: L4
      modelName: ${myModel.id}
      publicEndpoint:
        isEnabled: true
      acceptEula: true
variables:
  myModel:
    fn::invoke:
      function: scaleway:getInferenceModel
      arguments:
        name: meta/llama-3.1-8b-instruct:fp8
```
<!--End PulumiCodeChooser -->

## Import

Functions can be imported using, `{region}/{id}`, as shown below:

bash

```sh
$ pulumi import scaleway:index/inferenceDeployment:InferenceDeployment deployment fr-par/11111111-1111-1111-1111-111111111111
```

acceptEula.description: Some models (e.g Meta Llama) require end-user license agreements. Set `true` to accept.

maxSize.description: The maximum size of the pool.

minSize.description: The minimum size of the pool.

modelId.description: The model id used for the deployment.

modelName.description: The model name used for the deployment. Model names can be found in Console or using Scaleway's CLI (`scw inference model list`)

name.description: The deployment name.

nodeType.description: The node type to use for the deployment. Node types can be found using Scaleway's CLI (`scw inference node-type list`)

privateEndpoint.description: Configuration of the deployment's private endpoint.

privateIps.description: The private IPv4 address associated with the deployment.

projectId.description: `project_id`) The ID of the project the deployment is associated with.

publicEndpoint.description: Configuration of the deployment's public endpoint.

quantization.description: The number of bits each model parameter should be quantized to

region.description: `region`) The region in which the deployment is created.

size.description: The size of the pool.

tags.description: The tags associated with the deployment.

updatedAt.description: The date and time of the last update of the deployment.

secret.description: Authentication token used to pull the model from a private or gated URL (e.g., a Hugging Face access token with read permission).

sizeBytes.description: Total size, in bytes, of the model archive.

status.description: The current status of the model (e.g., ready, error, etc.).

tags.description: Tags associated with the model.

updatedAt.description: The date and time of the last update of the model

url.description: The HTTPS source URL from which the model will be downloaded. This is typically a Hugging Face repository URL (e.g., https://huggingface.co/agentica-org/DeepCoder-14B-Preview). The URL must be publicly accessible or require valid credentials via `secret`

additionalVolumeIds.description:
List of IDs of the snapshots of the additional volumes to be attached to the image.

> **Important:** For now it is only possible to have 1 additional_volume.

additionalVolumes.description: The description of the extra volumes attached to the image.

architecture.description: The architecture the image is compatible with. Possible values are: `x86_64` or `arm`.

fromServerId.description: ID of the server the image is based on (in case it is a backup).

name.description: The name of the image. If not provided it will be randomly generated.

organizationId.description: The organization ID the image is associated with.

projectId.description: The ID of the project the image is associated with.

public.description: Set to `true` if the image is public.

rootVolumeId.description: The ID of the snapshot of the volume to be used as root in the image.

tags.description: A list of tags to apply to the image.

zone.description: The zone in which the image should be created.

scaleway:index/instanceSecurityGroup:Ins.description:
## Import

Instance security group can be imported using the `{zone}/{id}`, e.g.

bash

```sh
$ pulumi import scaleway:index/instanceSecurityGroup:InstanceSecurityGroup web fr-par-1/11111111-1111-1111-1111-111111111111
```

description.description: The description of the security group.

enableDefaultSecurity.description: Whether to block SMTP on IPv4/IPv6 (Port 25, 465, 587). Set to false will unblock SMTP if your account is authorized to. If your organization is not yet authorized to send SMTP traffic, [open a support ticket](https://console.scaleway.com/support/tickets).

externalRules.description:
A boolean to specify whether to use instance_security_group_rules.
If `external_rules` is set to `true`, `inbound_rule` and `outbound_rule` can not be set directly in the security group.

inboundDefaultPolicy.description: The default policy on incoming traffic. Possible values are: `accept` or `drop`.

inboundRules.description: A list of inbound rule to add to the security group. (Structure is documented below.)

name.description: The name of the security group.

organizationId.description: The organization ID the security group is associated with.

outboundDefaultPolicy.description: The default policy on outgoing traffic. Possible values are: `accept` or `drop`.

outboundRules.description: A list of outbound rule to add to the security group. (Structure is documented below.)

projectId.description: `project_id`) The ID of the project the security group is associated with.

stateful.description: A boolean to specify whether the security group should be stateful or not.

tags.description: The tags associated with the security group

zone.description: `zone`) The zone in which the security group should be created.

additionalVolumeIds.description:
The [additional volumes](https://www.scaleway.com/en/developers/api/instance/#path-volume-types-list-volume-types)
attached to the server. Updates to this field will trigger a stop/start of the server.

> **Important:** If this field contains local volumes, the `state` must be set to `stopped`, otherwise it will fail.

> **Important:** If this field contains local volumes, you have to first detach them, in one apply, and then delete the volume in another apply.

adminPasswordEncryptionSshKeyId.description:
The ID of the SSH RSA key that will be used to encrypt the initial admin password for OS requiring it.
Mandatory for Windows OS. The public_key value of this key is used to encrypt the admin password.
When set to an empty string, it resets this value and admin_password_encrypted_value to an empty string so a new password may be generated.

bootType.description: The boot Type of the server. Possible values are: `local`, `bootscript` or `rescue`.

bootscriptId.description: ID of the target bootscript (set boot_type to bootscript)

cloudInit.description: The cloud init script associated with this server

enableDynamicIp.description: If true a dynamic IP will be attached to the server.

enableIpv6.description:
Determines if IPv6 is enabled for the server.
Deprecated: Please use a scaleway.InstanceIp with a `routed_ipv6` type.
enableIpv6.deprecationMessage: Please use a scaleway.InstanceIp with a `routed_ipv6` type

image.description:
The UUID or the label of the base image used by the server. You can use [this endpoint](https://www.scaleway.com/en/developers/api/marketplace/#path-marketplace-images-list-marketplace-images)
to find either the right `label` or the right local image `ID` for a given `type`. Optional when creating an instance with an existing root volume.

You can check the available labels with our [CLI](https://www.scaleway.com/en/docs/compute/instances/api-cli/creating-managing-instances-with-cliv2/). ```scw marketplace image list```

To retrieve more information by label please use: ```scw marketplace image get label=<LABEL>```

ipId.description: The ID of the reserved IP that is attached to the server.

ipIds.description:
List of ID of reserved IPs that are attached to the server. Cannot be used with `ip_id`.

> `ip_id` to `ip_ids` migration: if moving the ip from the old `ip_id` field to the new `ip_ids`, it should not detach the ip.

ipv6Address.description:
The default ipv6 address routed to the server. ( Only set when enable_ipv6 is set to true )
Deprecated: Please use a scaleway.InstanceIp with a `routed_ipv6` type.
ipv6Address.deprecationMessage: Please use a scaleway.InstanceIp with a `routed_ipv6` type

ipv6Gateway.description:
The ipv6 gateway address. ( Only set when enable_ipv6 is set to true )
Deprecated: Please use a scaleway.InstanceIp with a `routed_ipv6` type.
ipv6Gateway.deprecationMessage: Please use a scaleway.InstanceIp with a `routed_ipv6` type

ipv6PrefixLength.description:
The prefix length of the ipv6 subnet routed to the server. ( Only set when enable_ipv6 is set to true )
Deprecated: Please use a scaleway.InstanceIp with a `routed_ipv6` type.
ipv6PrefixLength.deprecationMessage: Please use a scaleway.InstanceIp with a `routed_ipv6` type

name.description: The name of the server.

organizationId.description: The organization ID the server is associated with.

placementGroupId.description:
The [placement group](https://www.scaleway.com/en/developers/api/instance/#path-security-groups-update-a-security-group the server is attached to.


> **Important:** When updating `placement_group_id` the `state` must be set to `stopped`, otherwise it will fail.

placementGroupPolicyRespected.description: (Deprecated) Always false, use instance_placement_group ressource to known when the placement group policy is respected.

privateIp.description: The Scaleway internal IP address of the server (Deprecated use ipam_ip datasource instead).
privateIp.deprecationMessage: Use ipam_ip datasource instead to fetch your server's IP in your private network.

privateIps.description: The list of private IPv4 and IPv6 addresses associated with the resource.

privateNetworks.description:
The private network associated with the server.
Use the `pn_id` key to attach a [private_network](https://www.scaleway.com/en/developers/api/instance/#path-private-nics-list-all-private-nics) on your instance.

projectId.description: `project_id`) The ID of the project the server is associated with.

protected.description: Set to true to activate server protection option.

publicIp.description: The public IP address of the server (Deprecated use `public_ips` instead).

publicIps.description: The list of public IPs of the server.

replaceOnTypeChange.description: If true, the server will be replaced if `type` is changed. Otherwise, the server will migrate.

rootVolume.description: Root [volume](https://www.scaleway.com/en/developers/api/instance/#path-volume-types-list-volume-types) attached to the server on creation.

securityGroupId.description: The security group the server is attached to

state.description: The state of the server. Possible values are: `started`, `stopped` or `standby`.

tags.description: The tags associated with the server.

type.description:
The commercial type of the server.
You find all the available types on the [pricing page](https://www.scaleway.com/en/pricing/).
Updates to this field will migrate the server, local storage constraint must be respected. [More info](https://www.scaleway.com/en/docs/compute/instances/api-cli/migrating-instances/).
Use `replace_on_type_change` to trigger replacement instead of migration.

> **Important:** If `type` change and migration occurs, the server will be stopped and changed backed to its original state. It will be started again if it was running.

userData.description:
The user data associated with the server.
Use the `cloud-init` key to use [cloud-init](https://cloudinit.readthedocs.io/en/latest/) on your instance.
You can define values using:
- string
- UTF-8 encoded file content using file
- Binary files using filebase64.

The [placement group](https://www.scaleway.com/en/developers/api/instance/#path-security-groups-update-a-security-group the server is attached to.


> **Important:** When updating `placement_group_id` the `state` must be set to `stopped`, otherwise it will fail.

privateNetworks.description:
The private network associated with the server.
Use the `pn_id` key to attach a [private_network](https://www.scaleway.com/en/developers/api/instance/#path-private-nics-list-all-private-nics) on your instance.

protected.description: Set to true to activate server protection option.

publicIp.description: The public IP address of the server (Deprecated use `public_ips` instead).

publicIps.description: The list of public IPs of the server.

replaceOnTypeChange.description: If true, the server will be replaced if `type` is changed. Otherwise, the server will migrate.

rootVolume.description: Root [volume](https://www.scaleway.com/en/developers/api/instance/#path-volume-types-list-volume-types) attached to the server on creation.

securityGroupId.description: The security group the server is attached to

state.description: The state of the server. Possible values are: `started`, `stopped` or `standby`.

tags.description: The tags associated with the server.

type.description:
The commercial type of the server.
You find all the available types on the [pricing page](https://www.scaleway.com/en/pricing/).
Updates to this field will migrate the server, local storage constraint must be respected. [More info](https://www.scaleway.com/en/docs/compute/instances/api-cli/migrating-instances/).
Use `replace_on_type_change` to trigger replacement instead of migration.

> **Important:** If `type` change and migration occurs, the server will be stopped and changed backed to its original state. It will be started again if it was running.

- string
- UTF-8 encoded file content using file
- Binary files using filebase64.

scaleway:index/ipamIpReverseDns:IpamIpRe.description:
Manage the reverse DNS of IP addresses managed by Scaleway's IP Address Management (IPAM) service.

For more information about IPAM, see the main [documentation](https://www.scaleway.com/en/docs/vpc/concepts/#ipam).

## Import

IPAM IP reverse DNS can be imported using `{region}/{id}`, e.g.

bash

```sh
$ pulumi import scaleway:index/ipamIpReverseDns:IpamIpReverseDns main fr-par/11111111-1111-1111-1111-111111111111
```

address.description: The IP corresponding to the hostname.

region.description: `region`) The region of the IP reverse DNS.

region.description: `region`) The region of the IP reverse DNS.

aclRules.description:
A list of ACLs (structure is described below)

> **Important:** This block cannot be defined if the `no_ip_allowed` field is set to true.

clusterId.description:
UUID of the cluster. The ID of the cluster is also the ID of the ACL resource, as there can only be one per cluster.

> **Important:** Updates to `cluster_id` will recreate the ACL.

noIpAllowed.description:
If set to true, no IP will be allowed and the cluster will be in full-isolation.

> **Important:** This field cannot be set to true if the `acl_rules` block is defined.

region.description: `region`) The region in which the ACL rule should be created.

UUID of the cluster. The ID of the cluster is also the ID of the ACL resource, as there can only be one per cluster.

> **Important:** Updates to `cluster_id` will recreate the ACL.

noIpAllowed.description:
If set to true, no IP will be allowed and the cluster will be in full-isolation.

> **Important:** This field cannot be set to true if the `acl_rules` block is defined.

region.description: `region`) The region in which the ACL rule should be created.

admissionPlugins.description: The list of [admission plugins](https://kubernetes.io/docs/reference/access-authn-authz/admission-controllers/) to enable on the cluster.

apiserverCertSans.description: Additional Subject Alternative Names for the Kubernetes API server certificate

apiserverUrl.description: The URL of the Kubernetes API server.

autoscalerConfig.description: The configuration options for the [Kubernetes cluster autoscaler](https://github.com/kubernetes/autoscaler/tree/master/cluster-autoscaler).

cni.description:
The Container Network Interface (CNI) for the Kubernetes cluster.
> **Important:** Updates to this field will recreate a new resource.

createdAt.description: The creation date of the cluster.

deleteAdditionalResources.description:
Delete additional resources like block volumes, load-balancers and the cluster's private network (if empty) that were created in Kubernetes on cluster deletion.
> **Important:** Setting this field to `true` means that you will lose all your cluster data and network configuration when you delete your cluster.
If you prefer keeping it, you should instead set it as `false`.

description.description: A description for the Kubernetes cluster.

featureGates.description: The list of [feature gates](https://kubernetes.io/docs/reference/command-line-tools-reference/feature-gates/) to enable on the cluster.

kubeconfigs.description: The kubeconfig configuration file of the Kubernetes cluster

name.description: The name for the Kubernetes cluster.

openIdConnectConfig.description: The OpenID Connect configuration of the cluster

organizationId.description: The organization ID the cluster is associated with.

privateNetworkId.description:
The ID of the private network of the cluster.

> **Important:** Changes to this field will recreate a new resource.

> **Important:** Private Networks are now mandatory with Kapsule Clusters. If you have a legacy cluster (no `private_network_id` set),
you can still set it now. In this case it will not destroy and recreate your cluster but migrate it to the Private Network.

tags.description: The tags associated with the Kubernetes cluster.

- for mutualized clusters: `kapsule` or `multicloud`

- for dedicated Kapsule clusters: `kapsule-dedicated-4`, `kapsule-dedicated-8` or `kapsule-dedicated-16`.

- for dedicated Kosmos clusters: `multicloud-dedicated-4`, `multicloud-dedicated-8` or `multicloud-dedicated-16`.

scaleway:index/k8sPool:K8sPool.description:
## Import

Kubernetes pools can be imported using the `{region}/{id}`, e.g.

bash

```sh
$ pulumi import scaleway:index/k8sPool:K8sPool mypool fr-par/11111111-1111-1111-1111-111111111111
```

autohealing.description: Enables the autohealing feature for this pool.

autoscaling.description:
Enables the autoscaling feature for this pool.

> **Important:** When enabled, an update of the `size` will not be taken into account.

clusterId.description: The ID of the Kubernetes cluster on which this pool will be created.

containerRuntime.description:
The container runtime of the pool.

> **Important:** Updates to this field will recreate a new resource.

createdAt.description: The creation date of the pool.

currentSize.description: The actual size of the pool

kubeletArgs.description: The Kubelet arguments to be used by this pool

maxSize.description: The maximum size of the pool, used by the autoscaling feature.

minSize.description: The minimum size of the pool, used by the autoscaling feature.

name.description:
The name for the pool.

> **Important:** Updates to this field will recreate a new resource.

nodeType.description:
The commercial type of the pool instances. Instances with insufficient memory are not eligible (DEV1-S, PLAY2-PICO, STARDUST). `external` is a special node type used to provision from other Cloud providers.

> **Important:** Updates to this field will recreate a new resource.

nodes.description: (List of) The nodes in the default pool.

placementGroupId.description:
The [placement group](https://www.scaleway.com/en/developers/api/instance/#path-placement-groups-create-a-placement-group) the nodes of the pool will be attached to.

> **Important:** Updates to this field will recreate a new resource.

publicIpDisabled.description:
Defines if the public IP should be removed from Nodes. To use this feature, your Cluster must have an attached Private Network set up with a Public Gateway.

> **Important:** Updates to this field will recreate a new resource.

region.description: `region`) The region in which the pool should be created.

rootVolumeSizeInGb.description: The size of the system volume of the nodes in gigabyte

rootVolumeType.description: System volume type of the nodes composing the pool

size.description:
The size of the pool.

> **Important:** This field will only be used at creation if autoscaling is enabled.

tags.description:
The tags associated with the pool.

> Note: As mentionned in [this document](https://github.com/scaleway/scaleway-cloud-controller-manager/blob/master/docs/tags.md#taints), taints of a pool's nodes are applied using tags. (e.g.: `"taint=taintName=taintValue:Effect"`)

updatedAt.description: The last update date of the pool.

waitForPoolReady.description: Whether to wait for the pool to be ready.

zone.description:
`zone`) The zone in which the pool should be created.

> **Important:** Updates to this field will recreate a new resource.

failoverHost.description:
Scaleway S3 bucket website to be served in case all backend servers are down **NOTE** : Only the host part of the
Scaleway S3 bucket website is expected. E.g. 'failover-website.s3-website.fr-par.scw.cloud' if your bucket website URL
is 'https://failover-website.s3-website.fr-par.scw.cloud/'.

forwardPort.description: User sessions will be forwarded to this port of backend servers

healthCheckMaxRetries.description: Number of allowed failed HC requests before the backend server is marked down

healthCheckPort.description: Port the HC requests will be send to. Default to `forward_port`

healthCheckSendProxy.description: Defines whether proxy protocol should be activated for the health check

healthCheckTimeout.description: Timeout before we consider a HC request failed

healthCheckTransientDelay.description: Time to wait between two consecutive health checks when a backend server is in a transient state (going UP or DOWN)

ignoreSslServerVerify.description: Specifies whether the Load Balancer should check the backend server’s certificate before initiating a connection

lbId.description: The load-balancer ID

maxConnections.description: Maximum number of connections allowed per backend server

maxRetries.description: Number of retries when a backend server connection failed

name.description: The name of the backend

onMarkedDownAction.description: Modify what occurs when a backend server is marked down

proxyProtocol.description: Type of PROXY protocol to enable

redispatchAttemptCount.description: Whether to use another backend server on each attempt

serverIps.description: Backend server IP addresses list (IPv4 or IPv6)

sslBridging.description: Enables SSL between load balancer and backend servers

timeoutConnect.description: Maximum initial server connection establishment time

timeoutQueue.description: Maximum time (in seconds) for a request to be left pending in queue when `max_connections` is reached

matchHostHeader.description:
The HTTP host header to match. Value to match in the HTTP Host request header from an incoming connection.
Only one of `match_sni`, `match_host_header` and `match_path_begin` should be specified.

> **Important:** This field should be set for routes on HTTP Load Balancers.

matchPathBegin.description:
The value to match in the URL beginning path from an incoming request.
Only one of `match_sni`, `match_host_header` and `match_path_begin` should be specified.

matchSni.description:
The Server Name Indication (SNI) value to match. Value to match in the Server Name Indication TLS extension (SNI) field from an incoming connection made via an SSL/TLS transport layer.
Only one of `match_sni`, `match_host_header` and `match_path_begin` should be specified.

> **Important:** This field should be set for routes on TCP Load Balancers.

matchSubdomains.description: If true, all subdomains will match.

acl.description:
(Deprecated) The canned ACL you want to apply to the bucket.

> **Note:** The `acl` attribute is deprecated. See scaleway.ObjectBucketAcl resource documentation. Refer to the [official canned ACL documentation](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/userguide/acl_overview.html#canned-acl) for more information on the different roles.
acl.deprecationMessage: ACL attribute is deprecated. Please use the resource scaleway.ObjectBucketAcl instead.

endpoint.description: The endpoint URL of the bucket.

forceDestroy.description: Boolean that, when set to true, allows the deletion of all objects (including locked objects) when the bucket is destroyed. This operation is irreversible, and the objects cannot be recovered. The default is false.

lifecycleRules.description: Lifecycle configuration is a set of rules that define actions that Scaleway Object Storage applies to a group of objects

name.description: The name of the bucket.

projectId.description: `project_id`) The ID of the project the bucket is associated with.

region.description: The [region](https://www.scaleway.com/en/developers/api/#region-definition) in which the bucket will be created.

tags.description:

scaleway:index/objectItem:ObjectItem.description:
The `scaleway.ObjectItem` resource allows you to create and manage objects for [Scaleway Object storage](https://www.scaleway.com/en/docs/object-storage/).

Refer to the [dedicated documentation](https://www.scaleway.com/en/docs/object-storage/how-to/upload-files-into-a-bucket/) for more information on Object Storage objects.

## Import

Objects can be imported using the `{region}/{bucketName}/{objectKey}` identifier, as shown below:

bash

```sh
$ pulumi import scaleway:index/objectItem:ObjectItem some_object fr-par/some-bucket/some-file
```

~> **Important:** The `project_id` attribute has a particular behavior with s3 products because the s3 API is scoped by project.

If you are using a project different from the default one, you have to specify the project ID at the end of the import command.

bash

```sh
$ pulumi import scaleway:index/objectItem:ObjectItem some_object fr-par/some-bucket/some-file@xxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxx
```

bucket.description: The bucket's name or regional ID.

content.description: The content of the file to upload. Only one of `file`, `content` or `content_base64` can be defined.

contentBase64.description:
The base64-encoded content of the file to upload. Only one of `file`, `content` or `content_base64` can be defined.

> **Note:** Only one of `file`, `content` or `content_base64` can be defined.

contentType.description: The standard MIME type of the object's content (e.g., 'application/json', 'text/plain'). This specifies how the object should be interpreted by clients. See RFC 9110: https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc9110.html#name-content-type

clusterSize.description:
The number of nodes in the Redis™ cluster.

> **Important:**

- Cluster_size = 1 for Standalone mode (single node).

- Cluster_size = 2 for High Availability (HA) mode, with 1 main node and 1 standby node.

- Cluster_size >= 3 for Cluster mode, which requires a minimum of 1 main node and 2 secondary nodes.

> **Important:** If you are using the cluster mode (>=3 nodes), you can set a bigger `cluster_size` than you initially
did, it will migrate the Redis™ cluster but keep in mind that you cannot downgrade a Redis™ cluster, so setting a smaller
`cluster_size` will destroy and recreate your cluster.

> **Important:** If you are using the Standalone mode (1 node), setting a bigger `cluster_size` will destroy and
recreate your cluster as you will be switching to the cluster mode.

you cannot downgrade a Redis™ cluster.

scaleway:index/secret:Secret.description:
## Import

This section explains how to import a secret using the `{region}/{id}` format.

bash

```sh
$ pulumi import scaleway:index/secret:Secret main fr-par/11111111-1111-1111-1111-111111111111
```

createdAt.description: Date and time of the secret's creation (in RFC 3339 format).

ephemeralPolicies.description: Ephemeral policy of the secret. Policy that defines whether/when a secret's versions expire. By default, the policy is applied to all the secret's versions.

name.description: Name of the secret (e.g. `my-secret`).

path.description: Path of the secret, defaults to `/`.

projectId.description: The project ID containing is the secret.

protected.description: True if secret protection is enabled on a given secret. A protected secret cannot be deleted.

region.description:
`region`) The region
in which the resource exists.

tags.description: Tags of the secret (e.g. `["tag", "secret"]`).

type.description: Type of the secret. If not specified, the type is Opaque. Available values can be found in [SDK Constants](https://pkg.go.dev/github.com/scaleway/scaleway-sdk-go@master/api/secret/v1beta1#pkg-constants).

dnsLocalName.description: TLD given to hostnames in the Private Network. Allowed characters are `a-z0-9-.`. Defaults to the slugified Private Network name if created along a GatewayNetwork, or else to `priv`.

dnsServersOverrides.description: Override the DNS server list pushed to DHCP clients, instead of the gateway itself.

enableDynamic.description: Whether to enable dynamic pooling of IPs. By turning the dynamic pool off, only pre-existing DHCP reservations will be handed out. Defaults to `true`.

organizationId.description: The Organization ID the Public Gateway DHCP config is associated with.

poolHigh.description: High IP (excluded) of the dynamic address pool. Defaults to the last address of the subnet.

poolLow.description: Low IP (included) of the dynamic address pool. Defaults to the second address of the subnet.

projectId.description: `project_id`) The ID of the Project the Public Gateway DHCP configuration is associated with.

pushDefaultRoute.description:
Whether the gateway should push a default route to DHCP clients or only hand out IPs. Defaults to `true`.

> **Warning**: If you need to setup a default route, it's recommended to use the `scaleway.VpcGatewayNetwork` resource instead.

pushDnsServer.description: Whether the gateway should push custom DNS servers to clients. This allows for instance hostname > IP resolution. Defaults to `true`.

rebindTimer.description: After how long, in seconds, a DHCP client will query for a new lease if previous renews fail. Must be 30s lower than `valid_lifetime`. Defaults to 51m (3060s).

renewTimer.description: After how long, in seconds, a renewal will be attempted. Must be 30s lower than `rebind_timer`. Defaults to 50m (3000s).

subnet.description: The subnet to associate with the Public Gateway DHCP configuration.

scaleway:index/getLbCertificate:getLbCer.description:
Get information about Scaleway Load Balancer certificates.

This data source can prove useful when a module accepts a Load Balancer certificate as an input variable and needs to, for example, determine the security of a certificate for the frontend associated with your domain.

For more information, see the [main documentation](https://www.scaleway.com/en/docs/load-balancer/how-to/add-certificate/) or [API documentation](https://www.scaleway.com/en/developers/api/load-balancer/zoned-api/#path-certificate).

## Examples

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getLbCertificate.

certificateId.description:
The certificate ID.
- Only one of `name` and `certificate_id` should be specified.

lbId.description: The Load Balancer ID this certificate is attached to.

name.description:
The name of the Load Balancer certificate.
- When using a certificate `name` you should specify the `lb-id`

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getLbCertificate.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.
